column1: The human brain is responsible for many functions
column2: and certain brain regions are responsible for specific tasks. For example
column3: the part of the brain called the motor cortex controls movements of the fingers
column7: and other body areas. The motor cortex has a lot of brain tissue for hand and finger movement
column10: or threading a needle. On the other hand
column11: we do not have very precise control of our leg muscles
column12: and so the motor cortex can control leg movement without quite so much brain tissue. Another important brain region is the somatosensory cortex
column13: which is responsible for the sense of touch. Without touch
column14: it would be very difficult to know how much to tighten a screw
column15: or to hold fragile items like grapes or a bottle of Coke. People might accidentally crush the grapes or the Coke bottle without feedback from the brain about how much force their hands produce.
